[b]DESCRIPTION[/b]
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢---------------------------------------------------------------ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢

[i][b]There are no colorful characters in "Gomorrah",Matteo Garrone's corrosive and ferociously unsentimental fictional look at Italian organized crime; no white-haired mamas lovingly stirring the spaghetti sauce; no opera arias swelling on the soundtrack; no homilies about family, honor or tradition; no dark jokes; no catchy pop songs; no film allusions; no winking fun; no thrilling violence. Instead, there is waste, grotesque human waste, some of which ends up illegally buried in the same ground where trees now bear bad fruit, some of which, like the teenager scooped up by a bulldozer on a desolate beach, is cast away like trash.
[/b][/i]
